Class ListCmd

java.lang.Object
LibraryCommand
ListCmd
public class ListCmd
extends LibraryCommand
Class for the Command LIST. This command is used to print all the books contained in a LibraryData, it has two formats: short, which includes only the titles of the books in the printing and long that includes all the information about the books. The default format is short.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private static java.lang.String BLANK_LINE
    Private String used to create new Blank Lines when printing.
    private static java.lang.String BOOKS_FOUND
    Private String used as a message to show how many books are in a given Library (LibraryData).
    private CommandOptionsList command
    Private field that is used to store the information about the format of listing that can be short, long or blank (using then the default value)
    private static java.lang.String COMMAND_OPTION
    Private String used to identify the given input with one of the possible commands.
    static java.lang.String NO_BOOK_ENTRIES
    Private String used as a message to tell the user that there are no book Entries in the given library.

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    ListCmd​(java.lang.String argumentInput)
    Constructor of the class ListCmd.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void execute​(LibraryData data)
    Overridden Method from the abstact method of the superClass.
    private boolean isNotEmptyBooks​(java.util.List<BookEntry> books)
    private Method that is used as a helper method of listBooks.
    private void listBooks​(java.util.List<BookEntry> books)
    Private method uses as a helper method of execute.
    protected boolean parseArguments​(java.lang.String argumentInput)
    Overridden Method used to check the validity of the given Argument Input (Supplied by the User) In this case it will check that the given input is corresponds with one of the allowed formats
    private boolean parseCommandOption​(java.lang.String ArgumentInput)
    Helper Method of parseArgumetns that is used to check if there is a correspondence between the given input and the allowed formats If it is blank then the command will be equal to the CommandOptionsList shortCommand, if the argument Input is short then the command will be equal to the CommandOptionList shortCommand and if the argument input is equal to long the command will be equal to longCommand.

  • Constructor Details

    • ListCmd

      public ListCmd​(java.lang.String argumentInput)
      Constructor of the class ListCmd. It calls the super-class Constructor using the CommandType List and the Argument input provided in the constructor. The super costructor will check if the given input is null and also it will call the method parseArgument to check if the given input is valid. (the overridden version)
      Parameters:
      argumentInput - (String) Input given by the user, it should refer to the format of listing that the User wants (short or long). Therefore it should only take 3 possible values:short, long or blank(""),

  • Method Details

    • execute

      public void execute​(LibraryData data)
      Overridden Method from the abstact method of the superClass. This method is used to print all the books contained in the given LibraryData according to the format given by the user. It uses a helper method called listBooks
      Specified by:
      execute in class LibraryCommand
      Parameters:
      data - book data to be considered for command execution.
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - if data is null or if the command is null.

    • listBooks

      private void listBooks​(java.util.List<BookEntry> books)
      Private method uses as a helper method of execute. This method is used to iterate over the List of BookEntries contained in a given libraryData and to print the content of the BookEntries according to the format given by the user.
      Parameters:
      books - is the list of bookEntries contained in the given Library. It must not be empty to enter to this method.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the command is not equivalent to one of the accepted commands, that would mean that an error has occurred during parsing

    • isNotEmptyBooks

      private boolean isNotEmptyBooks​(java.util.List<BookEntry> books)
      private Method that is used as a helper method of listBooks. it is used to check if a given List of BookEntries is not empty
      Parameters:
      books - given List of BookEntries that it is going to be checked.
      Returns:
      false if the List is empty (printing a message saying so) and true if it is not.

    • parseArguments

      protected boolean parseArguments​(java.lang.String argumentInput)
      Overridden Method used to check the validity of the given Argument Input (Supplied by the User) In this case it will check that the given input is corresponds with one of the allowed formats
      Overrides:
      parseArguments in class LibraryCommand
      Parameters:
      argumentInput - argument input for this command
      Returns:
      true if it is valid and false otherwise.

    • parseCommandOption

      private boolean parseCommandOption​(java.lang.String ArgumentInput)
      Helper Method of parseArgumetns that is used to check if there is a correspondence between the given input and the allowed formats If it is blank then the command will be equal to the CommandOptionsList shortCommand, if the argument Input is short then the command will be equal to the CommandOptionList shortCommand and if the argument input is equal to long the command will be equal to longCommand. Other option will return false.
      Parameters:
      ArgumentInput - argument input for this command
      Returns:
      true if the given ArgumentInput corresponds to an allowed format and false otherwise.
